article.headline: Arkansas 107, Portland State 69
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) -- Stan Heath knew Dontell Jefferson needed one more assist to tie the school record when he sent the point guard back in the game late in the second half. Jefferson said he didn't find out until after the game. "I'm not sure if my guys listen to me or not," Heath said with a laugh. Jefferson tied an Arkansas record with 15 assists, and the Razorbacks breezed to a 107-69 win over Portland State on Friday night. Arkansas led 60-29 at halftime en route to its 11th straight win in a season opener. The Razorbacks have not lost a home opener since 1974. With the game out of reach, Heath had his top players on the bench during the final minutes, but he wanted Jefferson to have a chance for another assist. "I wanted to get him back in there," Heath said. "I knew he needed one assist at the end, and I thought it would be great for him to get it." Jefferson found Sean McCurdy for a 3-pointer that put Arkansas ahead 103-57. That assist tied the mark set by Kareem Reid against Jackson State in 1996 -- although Jefferson said he wasn't told about it until later. After the game, he took the record in stride. "I was just making sure I got all my teammates involved," Jefferson said. "They made the shots -- they kind of made my job a little easier." Ronnie Brewer scored a career-high 24 points for Arkansas, 20 in the first half. He finished 9-of-16 from the field and had five steals. "Ronnie had a Ronnie night -- was pretty special out there," Heath said. Brewer, named Southeastern Conference preseason player of the year by league media, surpassed his previous high of 23 points. He had a trio of crowd-pleasing dunks in the first half -- a two-handed reverse on a breakaway, another reverse in traffic off an alley-oop from Jefferson and a one-handed dunk on a breakaway. The Razorbacks forced 15 turnovers in the first half. Arkansas led 33-10 after runs of 11-0 and 19-0. "We feel that one of our strengths this year is our quickness and our length on the court," Brewer said. "We knew if we put a lot of pressure on them they'd turn the ball over." Jake Schroeder scored 26 points for Portland State, a career high. The Vikings are coming off their first Big Sky Conference regular-season title, but Portland State lost six seniors to graduation and coach Heath Schroyer left to join the staff at Fresno State. Ken Bone replaced him. Charles Thomas had a career-high 20 points for Arkansas, and Jonathon Modica added 16. Thomas' seven rebounds was also a personal best. Arkansas scored its most points since Heath took over before the 2002-03 season. One of the Razorbacks' concerns heading into the season was the point guard spot. Heath has been evaluating Jefferson and freshman Sean McCurdy, and Brewer is also considered an option. Senior Eric Ferguson can play point guard, but he missed Friday night's game after being arrested on a misdemeanor drunken-driving charge. Jefferson, a senior, put those worries to rest for a night. "Dontell Jefferson's a great point guard," Thomas said. "This year, he's a whole lot smarter. He just makes a lot of great decisions with the ball this year." Heath said he'll probably decide Sunday night whether Ferguson will play in Arkansas' next game. The Razorbacks face No. 3 Connecticut on Monday night in the first round of the Maui Invitational.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
